title: Tabernas Desert
text:
The Tabernas Desert () is one of <a href="Spain">Spain</a>'s <a href="semi-arid">semi-arid</a> deserts, located within Spain's southeastern <a href="Almer%C3%ADa%20%28province%29">province of Almería</a>. It is in the interior, about north of the provincial capital <a href="Almer%C3%ADa">Almería</a>, in the <a href="Tabernas">Tabernas municipality</a> in <a href="Andalusia">Andalusia</a>.
Due to its high <a href="elevation">elevation</a> and inland location, it has slightly higher annual rainfall (more than per year) and lower annual average temperature than coastal areas of Almeria. A <a href="nature%20reserve">nature reserve</a> (protected area), it spans .
Climate.
The Tabernas Desert is defined mainly by a <a href="cold%20semi-arid%20climate">cold semi-arid climate</a> and a <a href="cold%20desert%20climate">cold desert climate</a>. Situated between the <a href="Sierra%20de%20los%20Filabres">Sierra de los Filabres</a> to the north and the <a href="Sierra%20de%20Alhamilla">Sierra de Alhamilla</a> to the south-southeast, it is isolated from the humid winds of the <a href="Mediterranean%20Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a>, in an area with little rainfall known as <a href="Levante%2C%20Spain">Levante</a>.
In the lowest elevations of the Tabernas basin (about above <a href="sea%20level">sea level</a>), the average annual temperature is close to . Due to its relative proximity to the coast and its relatively high altitude, temperatures in winter vary between in the higher altitudes to in the lower altitudes while temperatures in the summer vary from in the higher altitudes to in the lower altitudes. The annual average precipitation is (depending on the zone) with only one-third falling in the hot season (May to October). The average annual sunshine is about 2900 hours.
Thus the climate, from , is <a href="Semi-arid%20climate">semi-arid</a> of "<a href="Syria">Syrian</a>" type, which means that the dry season occurs during the hot season (the six hottest months of the year). This characteristic is also aggravated by the <a href="Foehn%20wind">foehn effect</a>.
Above about 800–900 meters the precipitation increases, thus reducing the dry summer season, while the temperature drops. At these elevations, the Tabernas basin climate is not semi-arid any more but <a href="Mediterranean%20climate">Mediterranean</a>.
Geology and biology.
The little rainfall that occurs is usually torrential, so that the ground, consisting of <a href="marl">marl</a>s and <a href="sandstone">sandstone</a> with little vegetation, is unable to retain moisture. Instead, the rain causes <a href="erosion">erosion</a>, forming the characteristic landscape of <a href="badland">badland</a>s. <a href="Arroyo%20%28creek%29">Arroyo</a>s formed by torrential rain harbor the scarce vegetation, as well as <a href="fauna">fauna</a> such as <a href="Swift%20%28bird%29">swift</a>s, <a href="hedgehog">hedgehog</a>s, <a href="jackdaw">jackdaw</a>s, <a href="pin-tailed%20sandgrouse">pin-tailed sandgrouse</a>, <a href="blue%20rock%20thrush">blue rock thrush</a>es, <a href="stone%20curlew">stone curlew</a>s, <a href="trumpeter%20finch">trumpeter finch</a>es, and <a href="crested%20lark">crested lark</a>s.
Flora and fauna.
The desert is well endowed with vegetation for a desert. Plants such as the sea lavender ("<a href="Limonium%20insignis">Limonium insignis</a>"), which are teetering on the verge of extinction, manage to flourish in the semi-arid environment of the desert. In winter, the landscape of the desert turns white when the toadflax linaria ("<a href="Nigricans%20lange">Nigricans lange</a>") flowers. There are specimens of yellow scorpions ("<a href="Buthus%20occitanus">Buthus occitanus</a>"), tarantulas ("<a href="Lycosa%20tarentulla">Lycosa tarentulla</a>") and black widows ("<a href="Latrodectus%20tredecimguttatus">Latrodectus tredecimguttatus</a>") although it's not deadly as the American black widow. Coastal areas have lesser weevers such as "<a href="Echiichthys%20vipera">Echiichthys vipera</a>" and "<a href="Tachinus%20dracco">Tachinus dracco</a>", which usually live under the sand.
Reptiles and amphibians.
The reptilian population of the desert includes <a href="ladder%20snake">ladder snake</a>s, <a href="spiny-footed%20lizard">spiny-footed lizard</a>s and <a href="ocellated%20lizard">ocellated lizard</a>s. <a href="Marsh%20frog">Marsh frog</a>s, <a href="natterjack%20toad">natterjack toad</a>s and <a href="terrapin">terrapin</a>s inhabit the moist areas of the desert.
Birds.
<a href="Birds%20of%20prey">Birds of prey</a> such as the <a href="Bonelli%27s%20eagle">Bonelli's eagle</a>s and <a href="peregrine%20falcon">peregrine falcon</a>s roam the desert's skies. Lesser hunters include <a href="kestrel">kestrel</a>s and <a href="eagle%20owl">eagle owl</a>s. Species such as the <a href="blue%20rock%20thrush">blue rock thrush</a>, <a href="rock%20sparrow">rock sparrow</a>, <a href="rock%20bunting">rock bunting</a> inhabit the rocky areas of the desert whereas <a href="warblers">warblers</a>, <a href="European%20goldfinch">goldfinch</a>es, <a href="golden%20oriole">golden oriole</a>s and <a href="serin">serin</a>s prefer the <a href="Arroyo%20%28creek%29">ramblas</a> near the dry river beds.
Mammals.
The desert does not have a great number of mammalian species, with the total number a meager 20. The <a href="North%20African%20hedgehog">Algerian hedgehog</a>, besides significant <a href="rabbit">rabbit</a>, <a href="hare">hare</a> and <a href="dormouse">dormouse</a> species, is one of the most important mammals inhabiting the area.
Cinema.
Because of its similarities to deserts in the <a href="Southwestern%20United%20States">southwestern</a> <a href="United%20States">United States</a>, <a href="Northern%20Mexico">northern</a> <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>, <a href="North%20Africa">northern</a> <a href="Africa">Africa</a>, and <a href="Arabian%20Peninsula">Arabia</a>, Tabernas has been a popular area to shoot many films since the 1950s. The <a href="Spaghetti%20Western">Spaghetti Western</a>s were shot at the three main studios, <a href="Texas%20Hollywood">Texas Hollywood</a>, <a href="Mini%20Hollywood">Mini Hollywood</a>, and <a href="Western%20Leone">Western Leone</a>.
The <a href="Game%20of%20Thrones%20%28season%206%29">sixth season</a> of the TV series "<a href="Game%20of%20Thrones">Game of Thrones</a>" was shot in locations from Andalusia to <a href="Catalonia">Catalonia</a>, including the desert, which is the <a href="Dothraki%20Sea">Dothraki Sea</a>, a gigantic steppe in <a href="Essos">Essos</a>, the largest continent.
